result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tanachie D Shearrod

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on November 14, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Treatment letter

Defendant Tanachie D Shearrod in court.  Attorney Peter R. Moyers in court for Tanachie D Shearrod.  Attorney Tomas Valerio for Trisha L Simmons in court for State of Wisconsin. DE reports case to proceed to trial. Ludwig: plea ct 1, 30 d DCJ I/S for 18 mo probation, cc. DE informs Court that she is accepting the offer. Court recesses for paperwork. 

Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to count(s) 1.  Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty. 

Letter presented to the Court. Court inquires as to whether assigned ADA has seen the letter. Assigned ADA has not and is out of office. Court adjourns for when assigned ADA is able to review the letter.

Bond continued.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Scheduling order as follows:
Discovery exchange by September 19, 2022
Plaintiff's lay and expert witness list and summaries due September 26, 2022
Defendant's lay and expert witness list and summaries due October 3, 2022
All motions including motions in limine due October 3, 2022

Jury status hearing on October 24, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Jury selection on November 14, 2022 at 08:00 am.
Jury trial on November 18, 2022 at 08:00 am.

Defendant Tanachie D Shearrod in court, in custody.  Attorney Peter R. Moyers in court for Tanachie D Shearrod.  Attorney Frank Remington for Patrick Winter in court for State of Wisconsin. Jt: plea ct 1. 2 years probation. 30 days conditional jail, stayed for parenting classes.  Ct finds plea Alford plea and sets for trial.
Jury status hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Jury selection scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 08:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 08:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 19, 2022 at 11:30 am.

Defendant in court with Attorney Peter R. Moyers.  Frank John Remington appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties request plea/sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 11:30 am.
and notice of DNA and witness list - State's
Pre-trial conference on July 8, 2022 at 10:15 am.

Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.

03:39 PM Defendant in court with Attorney Peter R. Moyers.  Awais Khaleel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant advised of right to and waived Preliminary Hearing (Preliminary Hearing Waiver signed); Court accepted waiver of Preliminary Hearing and ordered case bound over.
Atty Peter Moyers
Status conference on May 3, 2022 at 03:15 pm.

Reporter:  Patrick Weishan
 Colleen Lennon appeared for the State of Wisconsin; Defn qualifies for SPD but no attorney has been appointed as of yet; Defn waives time limits; preliminary hearing to be reset; bail continued
and returned.
Zoom
Preliminary hearing on April 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall report to the Dane County Jail to complete the booking/fingerprinting process within 10 days of today. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with any minor unless supervised by a responsible adult unless otherwise allowed by DHS. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with KS unless otherwise allowed by DHS. 
Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 11 

Defendant has acknowledged and agreed to terms and conditions of bond. Defendant must return signed bond form within 10 days of today. Any bail money previously posted will not be returned until a signed bond form is on file with the Clerk of Courts.

11:24 AM Defendant appeared.  Benjamin Wagner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties by Zoom. The defendant has NOT received a copy of the Complaint and waived receipt. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts. COURT TO MAIL COPY OF COMPLAINT TO DEFENDANT. Brief adjournment. 11:37 AM Case re-called.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
